summary:
After working 7 years in a Naval Research Institute in the Netherlands, I joined Shell in 1978.
Key reasons to join Shell: solid performing and well regarded company, opportunities for overseas assignment, regular job changes creating new challenges.

I have worked over 30 years in Shell in multiple locations around the world (Brunei, Egypt, Nigeria, Malaysia, Oman, Gabon, Netherland). Initially in the IT discipline. The last 15 years I  worked  on the interface between the Business and  IT on various Business Improvement projects supported by IT. Prime examples:
- as PM accountable for the deployment of SAP across all business supporting disciplines in Oman, Nigeria, Egypt. As part of that activity I also developed the global support organisation for SAP in Shell (1999 – 2007)
- as Global PM, accountable for he deployment of  the Engineering Data Model in support of Well Engineerings across all E&P companies of Shell (2007- 2010). 


In summary, an experienced Project Manager who has worked more than 30 years in the E&P oil industry in multiple cultures and senior positions.

Specialties: -	Sound E&P and IM&T knowledge 
-	Project management (PDM, PRT, PPM-PCP)
-	Good oral and written communication
-	Good presentation skills
-	Goal oriented and  highly motivated to deliver projects within agreed plan
-	Team player with strong leadership capabilities (leads by example)
-	Strong power of analysis and driving for root cause investigation/ resolution
-	Easily liaison with all levels in the organisation including top management
-	Contract management.

profile_positions.description:
Ref Programme manager Wells IT, accountable for the successful delivery of all Business Improvement initiatives supported by IM & IT in the Well Engineering business. Current key activities:
-	deployment of the well Integrity Management system for all Wells operated in Shell. Status. WIMS has fully deployed in Shell and considered in the Industry as a best practice
-	roll-out of the full scope of the Engineering R5000 (see below)
-	deployment of the Real Time Operating centers in support of the Well drilling activities. Completed
-	development and set-up of a global Well IT support organization providing 24*7 services to the global Wells organization. Completed.

Ref. Global Project Manager Engineering Data Model (EDM) R5000, accountable for the succesfull deployment of EDM R5000 globally. Current status:
-	EDM deployment has been completed in all regions in Shell (America, Europe, Far East, Russia, and Africa). Only outstanding region is Oman. Reason: different infrastructure.
-	Largest deployment of the EDM R5000 in the Industry.
-	Project activities are being closed out; transfer to Operation Support in progress
-	Size of the project team: 11 staff in the Central team, 30 globally 
-	Totals cost for 2010: USD 4.0 M.
profile_positions.title: Programme manager Wells IT /  Global Project manager Engineering Data model R5000

profile_positions.location: Oman,  Kuala Lumpur, Rijswijk, Lagos (Nigeria), Cairo (Egypt)
profile_positions.description:
** Sep 2000 – Dec 2001. Muscat Oman
EP SAP Blueprint development manager
As Blueprint development manager, responsible for the development of the first release of EP SAP Blueprint. This development was a joint responsibility with the PDO SAP project manager. 

**Jan 2002 - May 2002     SIEP - Location Kuala Lumpur
Development and Support manager
Responsible for the set-up of the global Development and Support Organisation for EP SAP Blueprint in Kuala Lumpur. This organisation, being the first global application support organisation in Shell, is a partnership of EP, SITI and Accenture.

** March 2004 – March 2005    SNEPCO, Lagos
SAP project manager
The SAP implementation project was kicked off in April 2004 with a planned go-live date of 3 January 2005. The project team comprises on average 30 resources (BP SAP consultants, business staff and data conversion resources). Total budget: 7.7 Million USD. A recent QA review has shown that the project is on track and, subject to the timely resolution of a number of known issues, the go-live date is considered sound.  Throughout the project, extensive attention has been given to change management covering all layers of the organization.

** April 2005 –  March 2007    SENV/Bapetco-  Cairo
 SAP project manager / SAP support manager
The SAP project kicked-off  April 2006. With an original planned go-live date of Jan 2006, due to the delayed start and resourcing, the final go-live date was set 3 April 2006. While the project was considered one single project, the distinct differences between both companies did result in substantial different approaches and efforts in support of all key activities of a SAP deployment project.  After the go-live date of April 2006, both companies did celebrate successfully month-end closings and able to continue their respective business activities with only limited negative impact of the SAP supported business processes .

This project made it the largest SAP deployment in E&P oil business
profile_positions.title: Global Project manager EDM phase II
